productSpecification:
The following features are delivered through the hardware:

     

  • WAN:

    • Embedded 4G LTE modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
    • Dual-modem capable with optional COR Extensibility Dock and compatible MC400 modular modem
    • One 10/100/1000 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN), one 10/100 (WAN or LAN)

  • LAN:

    • One 10/100/1000 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN), one 10/100 Ethernet port (WAN or LAN)

  • PORTS:

    • Power
    • 2-wire GPIO
    • Two ethernet LAN or WAN
    • Two (2) cellular antenna connectors (SMA)
    • Two (2) WiFi connectors* (RP-SMA), 5 dBi gain
    • Cradlepoint COR Extensibility Dock Port/custom cable Port (15-pin) with 4 GPIOs, power input, ignition sensing & 5 V out

  • TEMPERATURE:

    • –20° C to 60° C (–4° F to 140° F) operating
    • -30 °C to 70 °C (-22 °F to 158 °F) storage

  • HUMIDITY (non-condensing):

    • 5% to 95% operating
    • 5% to 95% storage

  • POWER:

    • DC input steady state voltage range: 9–33 VDC (requires inline fuse for vehicle installations)
      • For 9–24 VDC installations, use a 3 A fuse
      • For > 24 VDC installations, use a 2.5 A fuse
    • Reverse polarity and transient voltage protection per ISO 7637-2
    • Ignition sensing (automatic ON and time-delay OFF)
    • Power Consumption (@25ºC):
      • IBR600B
        • Idle: 1.98 W
        • Max: 12.24 W
      • IBR650B
        • Idle: 1.5 W
        • Max: 10.08 W
getConnect:
Connecting a Wired WAN

  1. Connect the provided Ethernet cable to the WAN port of the router. Connect the other end to your WAN source.

    • NOTE: The port labeled “WAN” is the default. However, all ports are LAN/WAN switchable.
insertSim:
Insert activated SIM card

  1. Slide the SIM door cover to the right to reveal the SIM slot.


  1. Insert an active 2FF-sized SIM card into the slot. Contacts down. Notch in. It will click into place. Depress the SIM card to remove it.
  1. Repeat for SIM 2, if needed.


  1. Slide the SIM door cover to the left to cover the SIM slots.
  1. Secure the SIM door with the SIM door screw.
attachCellularAntenna:
Attach the 4G LTE antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the connectors.
    • NOTE: Cellular antennas include RP-SMA connectors (pin in the center on the antenna) while Wi-Fi antennas include SMA connectors (pin in the center on the device connection point). Ensure you connect the correct antennas to their applicable connection locations.

  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the following diagram.
attachWifiAntenna:
Attach the Wi-Fi antenna

  1. Attach the included Wi-Fi antennas to the connectors.

  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Align the antenna at a 90-degree angle to the mounting surface.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
